errors.error_description: Air-fuel ratio sensor circuit malfunction - sensor signal out of expected range, causing incorrect fuel mixture and potential black smoke or power loss
Air conditioning refrigerant pressure sensor circuit fault - unable to read AC system pressure, may cause compressor cycling or cab cooling failure
Intake manifold temperature sensor circuit fault - incorrect air temperature readings affecting fuel injection timing and combustion efficiency
Fuel supply pressure sensor circuit malfunction - fuel rail pressure reading abnormal, risk of engine stalling or reduced power under load
Fuel level sensor circuit fault - fuel tank level reading inaccurate or intermittent, risk of unexpected fuel exhaustion in the field
Electrical system voltage out of range - battery charging voltage too high or too low, can damage ECM and electronic components
Engine oil pressure sensor circuit fault - oil pressure reading abnormal, risk of bearing damage or engine seizure if actual pressure is low
Engine coolant temperature sensor circuit fault - coolant temp reading inaccurate, risk of undetected overheating causing head gasket or cylinder damage
Engine speed/timing sensor circuit fault - unable to read crankshaft RPM, engine may not start or may stall unexpectedly
Throttle position sensor circuit error - erratic throttle response or limp mode activation, reduced machine productivity
Transmission oil pressure sensor circuit fault - abnormal transmission hydraulic pressure reading, risk of gear slipping or harsh shifts
Transmission oil temperature sensor fault - unable to detect overheating in transmission fluid, risk of premature wear and seal failure
Hydraulic pump pressure sensor circuit fault - abnormal main hydraulic pump pressure reading, may cause slow or jerky implement movement
Hydraulic oil temperature sensor fault - hydraulic fluid temperature reading abnormal, risk of oil breakdown and accelerated seal wear
Hydraulic oil level sensor fault - unable to verify hydraulic fluid reservoir level, risk of pump cavitation and system damage
Hydraulic pilot pressure sensor fault - pilot circuit pressure reading abnormal, may cause unresponsive joystick or implement controls
Swing motor pressure sensor fault - swing drive pressure abnormal, upper structure may swing slowly or erratically
Track drive motor pressure sensor fault - travel motor pressure reading abnormal, machine may track slowly or pull to one side
Turbocharger boost pressure sensor circuit fault - abnormal boost reading, engine may derate or produce excessive exhaust smoke
Fuel temperature sensor circuit fault - diesel fuel temperature reading abnormal, affects fuel injection volume calculation
Engine timing calibration fault - injector timing offset detected, engine runs rough with increased fuel consumption and emissions
After-treatment DPF differential pressure sensor fault - cannot monitor soot load in diesel particulate filter, risk of forced regeneration failure
After-treatment DEF quality sensor fault - diesel exhaust fluid quality reading abnormal, may trigger engine derate
Injection actuation pressure sensor fault - high-pressure oil circuit reading abnormal in HEUI systems, engine may not start or run rough
Atmospheric pressure sensor fault - barometric pressure reading abnormal, affects fuel and turbo boost compensation at altitude
CAT Data Link communication fault - ECM unable to communicate on the CAT proprietary data link, loss of machine monitoring and diagnostics
CAN Data Link fault - J1939 CAN bus communication loss between ECMs, may affect coordinated machine functions
Brake oil pressure switch circuit fault - service brake pressure warning inoperative, critical safety risk if brakes are low
Parking brake solenoid circuit fault - parking brake may not engage or release properly, risk of machine rollaway
Steering pressure sensor fault - steering circuit pressure reading abnormal, may cause heavy or unresponsive steering
Cooling fan speed sensor fault - unable to read radiator fan RPM, risk of undetected cooling system failure and engine overheating
Bucket/implement position sensor fault - implement angle or position reading abnormal, may affect auto-dig or grade control functions
Boom raise pressure sensor fault - boom cylinder pressure reading abnormal, may cause slow boom lift or unexpected lowering
Stick (arm) cylinder pressure sensor fault - stick circuit pressure abnormal, excavator digging force may be reduced
Ride control accumulator pressure sensor fault - ride control system pressure reading abnormal, rough ride and material spillage during travel
Tire pressure monitoring sensor fault - TPMS signal lost or reading abnormal for one or more tires, risk of blowout or uneven wear
Rim bolt torque monitoring fault - lug nut or rim bolt tension outside specification, risk of wheel separation during operation
Cab door interlock switch fault - cab door open/closed sensor malfunction, may prevent machine start or disable safety interlocks
Cab glass wiper motor circuit fault - windshield wiper inoperative, reduced visibility in rain or dusty conditions
Handrail/step lighting circuit fault - access lighting on steps and handrails inoperative, increased fall risk during entry/exit
Engine oil temperature sensor fault - oil temp reading abnormal, risk of undetected thermal breakdown of lubricant
Intake manifold air pressure (boost) sensor fault - MAP sensor reading abnormal, affects fuel delivery and turbo boost control
Starter motor relay circuit fault - starter solenoid not engaging, engine will not crank
Glow plug circuit fault - pre-heat system malfunction, difficult cold-start in low ambient temperatures
Track tension sensor fault - automatic track tensioner reading abnormal, risk of track throwing or accelerated undercarriage wear
Track link wear sensor fault - undercarriage wear measurement system reading abnormal, unable to predict track replacement interval
